title: Major Project 1
text:
This is an R Markdown Notebook. When you execute code within the notebook, the results appear beneath the code.
Try executing this chunk by clicking the Run button within the chunk or by placing your cursor inside it and pressing Cmd+Shift+Enter.

library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors


```
Add a new chunk by clicking the Insert Chunk button on the toolbar or by pressing Cmd+Option+I.
When you save the notebook, an HTML file containing the code and output will be saved alongside it (click the Preview button or press Cmd+Shift+K to preview the HTML file).
The preview shows you a rendered HTML copy of the contents of the editor. Consequently, unlike Knit, Preview does not run any R code chunks. Instead, the output of the chunk when it was last run in the editor is displayed.

mlb


baseball

title: Does Bobby Witt Jr. Deserve an MVP in 2024?
text:
Bobby Witt Jr. had a historic season in 2024. He deserved to win an MVP and the numbers show it.


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(ggrepel)
library(waffle)
library(ggtext)
library(ggalt)
library(gt)

bobby_batting <- read_csv("data/batting.csv")

  top_war <- bobby_batting |>
  filter(
    Rk < 16
  )

bobby <- top_war |>
  filter(
    Player == "Bobby Witt Jr."
  )

judge <- top_war |>
  filter(
    Player == "Aaron Judge"
  )

ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=top_war, aes(x=reorder(Player, H), weight=H)) + 
  geom_bar(data=bobby, aes(x=reorder(Player, H), weight=H), fill="gold") +
  geom_bar(data=judge, aes(x=reorder(Player, H), weight=H), fill="navyblue") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(
    title = "Bobby Witt Jr. Led the MLB in Hits",
    subtitle = "In 2024, <span style = 'color:gold;'>Witt Jr.</span> outpaced <span style = 'color:navy;'>Judge</span> by a decent margin in total hits.",
    caption = "Sources: Baseball Reference | By Gio Carnazzo",
    x = "MVP Candidates",
    y = "Hits",
  ) + theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 16),
    plot.subtitle = element_textbox_simple(size = 10),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  )









Waffle chart to come.
We can also look at how he compares to past AL MVP’s.


Code
bobby_mvp_data <- read_csv("data/mvp.csv")

mvp_position <- bobby_mvp_data |>
  filter(WAR > 0 & BA > 0.2)

bob <- mvp_position |> filter(Name == "Bobby Witt Jr.")

aj <- mvp_position |> filter(Name == "Aaron Judge", Year == "2024")

ggplot() + 
  geom_point(data = mvp_position, aes(x = WAR, y = BA), color="lightgrey") +
  geom_point(data = bob, aes(x = WAR, y = BA), color="gold") +
  geom_point(data = aj, aes(x = WAR, y = BA), color="navy") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
       x = "WAR",
       y = "Batting Average", 
       title = "Comparing Witt Jr. and Judge to Every MVP since 1999",
       subtitle = "<span style = 'color:gold;'>Witt Jr.</span> and <span style = 'color:navy;'>Judge</span> end up amongst the most productive MVP seasons in the last 25 years.",
       caption="Source: Baseball Reference | By Gio Carnazzo") +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_textbox_simple(size = 12),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 10),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  )









This is my last plot.

title: About
text: This is Giovanni Carnazzo’s sports blog. On this page, he is looking into statistical norms and abnormalities which tell help journalists tell stories.
